sen.j: 雲母坂（きららざか）は、京都市左京区修学院の修学院離宮脇より、比叡山の山頂に至る古道であり、また、延暦寺千日回峰行の行者道でもある。
sen.e: Kirara-zaka Slope indicates the old road to the mountain top of Hiei-zan Mountain from a side of Shugakuin Rikyu (the Shugakuin imperial villa) in Shugakuin, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, and is also a road used by the ascetics who practiced Sennichi-kaihogyo (a practice of walking around the mountain while paying visits to various sacred places for 1,000 day in total).

sen.j: 現在ではこの登山道が雲母坂として知られているが、具体的場所については同じくこの行者道の一部であった京都市左京区一乗寺 (京都市)の曼殊院道（京都府道104号高野修学院山端線部分）や、曼殊院参道とする説などもある。
sen.e: At present, this mountain-climbing path is known as Kirara-zaka Slope, but there are other opinions saying that Kirara-zaka Slope indicates Manshuin-michi Road (the Takano Shugakuin-Yamabana road portion of Kyoto Prefectural road 104) in Ichijo-ji, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City or the road to approach Manju-in Temple.

sen.j: 坂の名である「雲母」の由縁は、この山道が花崗岩の砕けた地質であり、土砂中に雲母が含まれていることによる、とされるが、異説もある。
sen.e: The reason why the name of the slope is Kirara is said that the soil of the mountain path includes cracked granite, including Kirara (雲母: mica), but there exist other opinions.

sen.e: To reach the present mountain-climbing road, walk toward the montain side in the east from Shugakuin Station on the Eizan Line of Eizan Electric Railway or from the Shugakuin Rikyu-michi Road bus stop of Kyoto City Bus, and then climb along the Otowa-gawa River (in Kyoto Prefecture).
